item.title: Senate approves shutdown ending legislation, sending bill to the House for a vote
item.description: After 41 days of a government shutdown, the U.S. Senate has passed a set of bills to reopen the government. Its fate in the House is uncertain.

item.title: Families accuse Camp Mystic of ignoring risks in Texas lawsuit over flood deaths

item.title: Shopping for an Affordable Care Act health plan? NPR wants to hear your experience
item.description: If you buy your own health insurance through the ACA marketplaces, how do this year's prices look to you?
